summary: This document is an email chain from August 12, 2019, discussing discrepancies in jail logs regarding Jeffrey Epstein's status. One log indicates he was on 'Psych Ops' (psychological observation) while another says 'suicide', raising questions about the consistency of record-keeping during his incarceration.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the jail logs being discussed; the emails concern the records of his status (psychological observation vs. suicide) while in custody.

events.title: Epstein's Jail Companion Duty Shift
events.description: An inmate companion assumed duties for Jeffrey Epstein from staff on July 23, 2019, at 7 am until July 24, 2019, at 8:45 am.

events.title: Email Discussion of Log Discrepancies
events.description: On August 12, 2019, emails were exchanged highlighting a discrepancy in jail logs for Jeffrey Epstein, where one log stated 'Psych Ops' and another stated 'suicide'.

keyFacts: A significant discrepancy exists in official jail logs regarding Jeffrey Epstein's status, with one log recording 'Psych Ops' (psychological operations/observation) and another recording 'suicide'.
The emails were sent on August 12, 2019, and reference a duty shift for an inmate companion covering Epstein from July 23 to July 24, 2019.
The correspondence raises direct questions about the consistency and accuracy of record-keeping for Epstein while he was in custody.
